Thank you to those across the country who continue speak up about #Flint. What happened to my hometown still breaks my heart. 

Five years later, this water crisis is ongoing. But I know that #Flint is a strong and resilient community with tons of opportunity. #DontForgetFlint

What happened to #Flint is not an anomaly.

Rather, what happened to Flint is a warning to other communities across America. We must get serious about improving America’s aging water infrastructure. #FlintWaterCrisis #DontForgetFlint
I will continue to work with @GovWhitmer to get real relief and support to #Flint families, including bottled water service until every lead pipe is replaced. #FlintWaterCrisis #DontForgetFlint

Five years after this crisis began, I am pleased that Michigan’s new Governor, @GovWhitmer, has made #Flint's recovery a priority. Her actions are a stark difference from the last Republican administration that created this crisis. #FlintWaterCrisis #DontForgetFlint

While I am proud that Congress passed a $170 million aid package for #Flint to help remove lead pipes & expand health care for families exposed to high levels of lead, more must be done to ensure that Flint recovers from this man-made crisis. #FlintWaterCrisis #DontForgetFlint

Five years, #Flint families still do not trust the water coming out of their taps. 

In the richest country in the world, every family should have access to clean and affordable drinking water. #FlintWaterCrisis #DontForgetFlint

While the #MuellerReport did not draw an ultimate conclusion about whether the President’s conduct was criminal, the report explicitly states that it does not exonerate @realDonaldTrump.

The American people now can read the redacted report and draw their own conclusions.
In addition, the #MuellerReport also lays out evidence that @realDonaldTrump attempted to ‘curtail the Special Counsel’s investigation and prevent the disclosure of evidence.’
The #MuellerReport outlines, in painstaking detail, evidence that the Russian government interfered ‘in sweeping and systematic fashion’ in the 2016 election.

The Attorney General—the nation’s highest-ranking law enforcement official—is supposed to be free from political influence. Yet William Barr’s rush to defend the president by presenting only select facts calls into question his ability to serve as Attorney General.

While I continue to read the #MuellerReport, it’s clear that prior to its release, the Attorney General inappropriately cherry-picked select passages to present a more flattering portrayal of @realDonaldTrump, his campaign and administration officials.

I appreciate my colleagues, including @SenStabenow for introducing the Senate companion of the VETS PFAS Act, as well as @RepSlotkin, @RepRashida, @RepAndyLevin, @RepDean and @RepChrisPappas for being original cosponsors and helping to announce this legislation today.

This is one step, but a big step, in helping to address #PFAS chemical contamination in Oscoda and hundreds of other communities across the country. I will continue to work with the bipartisan PFAS Task Force we've established in Congress to push for urgent action.

PFAS exposure has been linked to many health issues, including cancer, high cholesterol, weakened immune system & hypertension during pregnancy. But for many veterans exposed to #PFAS, the military has refused to cover these health issues as service-related issues.

The VETS PFAS Act would require the VA to cover treatment of certain health conditions related to #PFAS exposure. Under our bill, PFAS exposure, as a part of military service, would be considered a service-connected disability, making veterans eligible for disability & VA care.

When veterans sign up to serve in the military, we make a promise to them that in exchange for their service, we will take care of them & their families when they get home. 

The bill we are introducing today, the VETS #PFAS Act, helps to make good on that promise.

Happening now: I’m introducing legislation to ensure that veterans and their families exposed to dangerous #PFAS chemicals get the health care services and benefits they need through the VA. 

Watch live as we introduce this important bill:  http://tinyurl.com/yy7xsptn

.@HouseDemocrats passed the Paycheck Fairness Act to end pay disparities in the workplace. The bill:

➡Requires employers to prove pay disparities are job related
➡Bars retaliation against women who reveal wages
➡Prohibit reliance on salary history for future pay

#EqualPayDay

Women are still earning less than men for doing the same work. Today is #EqualPayDay, which marks the day when women’s wages catch up to what men were paid in the previous year. Today, and every day, @HouseDemocrats will continue to fight for equity in the workplace. pic.twitter.com/PQPFw2Kp7b
